Expectation1: Maintain regular communication with family members
Situation1: A family member has a new job and has shared some initial excitement about it with their relatives.
Expectation2: Maintain client confidentiality and ethical standards
Situation2: During a casual networking event, someone casually asks about the nature of a client’s case.
Story: I sat at the family dinner table, my grandson’s eyes shining as he talked about his new job. The whole family was eager to hear every detail, and I felt the warmth of being included in their excitement. As a grandfather, I knew how important it was to stay connected, to show interest, and to share in these moments. Later that evening, I attended a networking event for lawyers. A colleague, who happened to be a distant relative, leaned in and asked about a high-profile case I was handling. “Just between us,” he said, “what’s really going on with your client?” I felt the weight of my profession settle on my shoulders. As a lawyer, I was bound by confidentiality, unable to share even the smallest detail. Yet, as a grandfather and family member, there was an unspoken expectation to be open, to trust, and to connect. The two worlds collided inside me, and I could feel the tension rising, torn between loyalty to my family and my duty to my client.
